headline: Don't Believe the Hype: This Stock Could Survive the "SaaSpocalypse"
summary: Not every software stock deserves to be downgraded due to the potential threat of AI-powered alternatives.

headline: Salesforce quietly raised its dividend to pacify activist funds
summary: While most headlines fixate on Salesforce’s aggressive push into AI agents and its $60 billion revenue target, something else happened in early December that speaks volumes about who's really calling the shots. Salesforce (CRM), a Dow Jones 30 stock, increased its quarterly dividend to ...

headline: Famous Investor Dan Ives Calls Software Apocalypse a ‘Generational Buy’: Is He Right?
summary: As software stocks crater on AI disruption fears, Wedbush analyst Dan Ives is taking a contrarian stance on the selloff. Ives says the current selloff is “the worst he’s witnessed in 25 years” but believes investors are making a critical mistake by treating enterprise software as obsolete in the AI era. The numbers tell a ... Famous Investor Dan Ives Calls Software Apocalypse a ‘Generational Buy’: Is He Right?

headline: The Great Rotation From Tech To REITs Is Finally Here
summary: AI is eroding business moats and accelerating competition across sectors. Read why real assets like REITs benefit as capital rotates to anti-AI investments.

headline: Dan Ives Calls AI-Driven Software Selloff 'Most Disconnected Trade,' Says Salesforce And ServiceNow Are Historic Buys
summary: Dan Ives said Wall Street is overestimating AI's near-term threat to enterprise software, calling the selloff in Salesforce and ServiceNow a major buying opportunity despite recent stock declines.

raw.headline: Dan Ives Calls AI-Driven Software Selloff 'Most Disconnected Trade,' Says Salesforce And ServiceNow Are Historic Buys

headline: Salesforce AI Push With Cimulate Faces Valuation Question And Culture Risks
summary: Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) has agreed to acquire AI startup Cimulate to support its AI powered commerce efforts. More than 1,400 employees have signed a letter urging the company to end contracts with U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement. The developments come alongside nearly 1,000 recent job cuts and a wide ranging leadership reshuffle. For you as an investor watching NYSE:CRM, this mix of product expansion and internal pushback arrives at a time when large software providers are racing to...
